title: Where I was When 9/11 Happened
name: Where I was When 9/11 Happened
description:
A Map by Edshepp

Where you were the moment when 9/11 happened.  That could mean where you were when the first plane hit or when you heard what happened.

properties.description: Posted by Kaybear944302 Old Hickory Blvd.
Posted by Jvdlearning some math...

Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  rue du SoleilI was at home by myself. Erik called from work to tell me, and I turned on the TV. I couldn\'t believe it. I poured myself a drink. I watched the news for about an hour and then turned off the television. Every person I knew in France called me to express their sympathy, which I remember felt strange to me at the time. Unlike many Americans, I didn\'t feel as if I had been personally attacked. I just felt dumbfounded by the horror.

properties.name: 1st day of testing
properties.description: Posted by Woodduck2nd floor of GEICO\'s IT departmentWe were introducing a major new system, and I was in charge of the testing. 9/11 was our first day to test the full system, and I got started about 7:30. When the dastardly deed occurred, I was deep into the 1st tier of programs, and things in my little world were going well. Very well. Virtually all work around me stopped, with people standing everywhere, talking over cube walls like so many gophers popped out of their holes. My wife called, asking me to come home (we lived over an hour away) because she didn\'t want me to die. There is nothing of any headline value or strategic value around, so I felt reasonably safe and preferred to stay where I was rather than risk aeons on the Beltway and Cabin John, er, Veterans Memorial Bridge - which I felt were significantly more likely targets than my humble building. So I continued working. We completed a full cycle of testing that day in about 14 hours, which was very impressive as trial tests earlier had taken days to run. Testing the next day ran in about 12 hours, and dropped to 8 by the end of the week. After we got into routine we typically completed the cycle of testing in about 6.5 hours, to everyone\'s delight. (Not that anyone really cares about how well our testing went. Or how wonderful and indispensable I was to the effort. *toot toot!* *pat pat*) I finally got to see video of the crashes and collapses on the 11 o\'clock news. And the follow up reports after the new. And the hollow-eyed comments by Dan Rather and other reports who had been working all day, and were beyond beautifying by their make-up units. I couldn\'t help but feel for the workers who had gone in to their jobs, as I had, for a good day\'s work, but unlike me, never finished. Well, not in the way they would have preferred. And knowing how my own wife worried, felt for the families they left behind.

properties.name: 301 Elizabeth
properties.description: Posted by Heif301 elizabeth, 10012

properties.name: 327 Henry Street, my old apartment
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman327 Henry St New York NYI was in bed, deliberately oversleeping. I remember hearing a really loud pop-thud sound and thinking, "I don\'t care if the world is ending, I just need 15...more...minutes...in bed." Of course, I just thought it was a gas main exploding. The picture is from a year and a half later, but that\'s about what my bed would have looked like after my roommate dragged me downstairs in my nightgown to see the catastrophe. Right below those blue curtains -- that\'s where I was standing as I watched the second tower fall.

properties.name: 5th Avenue Court - 9/11
properties.description: Posted by JakeHeatboy woke me up with an early phone call, saying \'oh my god, turn on the news, we\'ve been attacked!!!\' ARE YOU KIDDING ME? WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT??? \'TURN ON CNN RIGHT NOW!\' I called my father as I was in shock as to what I was seeing and could not make sense of it. He told me to just keep an eye on the news, and chill out on work, we\'ll know more later. Of course, the buildings hadn\'t fallen yet, the Pentagon hadn\'t been hit, and there was still the other plane, which led to days of a frazzled Aaron Brown giving me the scoop

properties.name: 9.11.2001  Williamsburg Brooklyn NY
properties.description: Posted by HiveRubbed my eyes in disbelief from the abandoned piers.

properties.name: 911 Dispatch Center
properties.description: Posted by Starshadowrose611 State Street, Hood River, OR 97031I had just gotten to work at the local 911 Dispatch...

properties.name: A beautiful day, gone to Hell
properties.description: Posted by Rico, , MA1825 days ago, it was all over. The second tower was down, and the dust was beginning to settle. My ladyfriend and I were just getting off the ferry from Nantucket. One of her children was working in lower Manhattan, the other near Pittsburgh, and she couldn\'t raise either of them on cellphone. For us, it was a bad morning. For 3,030 Americans, it was their last morning. We had wonderful weather, in the Northeast; clear, almost no clouds, warm, dry. A beautiful fall day. Too bad we couldn\'t really appreciate it.

properties.name: Alamo Square, San Francisco
properties.description: Posted by Mefestus725 Steiner Street, San Francisco, CAMy girlfriend and I lived on Alamo Square. Our friend Todd called us from Oakland, said to turn on the TV. I was working then in Mill Valley and had to go there in the afternoon. There were still rumors of planes in the air, still unaccounted for. I counted as I crossed the Golden Gate Bridge and kept telling myself that if I saw a plane coming, I\'d have time to make it to the other side.

properties.name: Amsterdam
properties.description: Posted by ZinemapsHolland

properties.name: Apartment in the Sky
properties.description: Posted by Thingles110 w grant st, minneapolis, mnLived on the 21st floor of this downtown building.

properties.name: Asleep @ my grandparents on my day off...
properties.description: Posted by Lesaura3300 Princeton Way, Anchorage, AK

properties.name: Asleep and ditching class.
properties.description: Posted by YenviousI was waken up by my roommate at around 1pm. They were in the living room watching the news, and he came in and said, "You\'d better wake up soon, terrorists have just bombed the world trade center." I thought it was a joke. The first thing I saw of it was the footage of the 2nd tower collapsing. It was bizzare. -- This was a strange place to live. I drank my first absinthe with the folks I lived with here, all older than me by 8 or 9 years, and the only reason we left was that Meagan didn\'t pay the rent and the landlords evicted us.

properties.name: At the office, rue du Faubourg Saint Martin, Paris
properties.description: Posted by Erikparis, france"What? What kind of plane? A small propeller plane, something like that?" Jackie was on the phone with a friend in the US: "No, a big plane." Let\'s see what CNN says. Site... not... there... NYTimes? Dead. Finally Slashdot or something: a big plane. And another one? What?!?! What the fuck is going on?!? Then a blur, pictures, rumors, voices, instant messages, fear, sadness, anger, disbelief and then more disbelief.

properties.name: At work
properties.description: Posted by Oleandercolumbia MOI was working with a group of computer geeks who were in the habit of creating bogus websites and trying to pass them off as real events to coworkers. Therefore, it was lunchtime (when I walked in to see CNN broadcasts on the lunchroom television) before I realized this thing was real.

properties.name: At work
properties.description: Posted by Philocer

properties.name: Bally's Total Fitness - Studio City
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie  11315 Ventura Blvd., Studio City, CA

properties.name: Being woken by a friend.
properties.description: Posted by Phototron308 S. Perry Pl, Kennewick, Wa 99336I was called by a friend a little before 8am telling me the news. I didn\'t believe her because she gets paniced easily. I asked her what channel she was watching sure that it was a movie. It wasn\'t. I found my parents to make sure they knew. They did. I was buying a car that day, from a private owner, it was strange, we talked about it for an hour while we where signing the papers. An them on a street not so far from here, in route to the friend I had not truseted\'s home, their where two new in the street waving flags, with signs saying we needed to go bomb someone, on that very day.

properties.name: Breakfast on a Tuesday
properties.description: Posted by VisI was eating at the cafeteria. Someone said, "a plane ran into the towers." I thought it was some minor accident, but I said a prayer for the situation anyway before I ate some eggs.

properties.name: British Gas Offices, Cardiff
properties.description: Posted by SpinneyheadI did have an article on my site made up of all my e-mails from that day, but it recently got deleted. Some time I\'ll put it back up on my blog.

properties.name: CTIA Wireless, San Diego, CA
properties.description: Posted by Gisuseron 9/11, 2001 I was attending the CTIA Wireless industry trade show at the convention center in San Diego. I recall getting a phone call informing me of what happened. Then there were thousands of us at the convention (which was put on hold) and we were all walking around the trade show watching the news unfold on the news. I recall meeting somme people that had been inn contact (via wireless, blackberry etc...) with their loved ones in and around ground zero. One guy had been conversing with a person inside the towers.. it was truly a day none of us will ever forget.

properties.name: Claude calls
properties.description: Posted by KaicarverUnemployed, hanging out at home with Birgit. Phone rings. - Salut c\'est Claude. - Salut ça va? - Euh, ouais, t\'as entendu la nouvelle? - Euh, non, quelle nouvelle? - Yaurait des avions qui sont rentrés dans les tour jumelles à New York. - Quoi!? - Ouais, c\'est pas clair. Mais c\'est pas pour ça que je t\'appelle. T\'aurais pas le numéro de Jenny? - Euuhhhh... Le numéro... Numbly, I give the phone number and hang up. Birgit has gone on the Internet. I tell her it won\'t work. I turn on the radio. News confirmed. We decide to go to Tracy and Erik\'s, where there\'s a TV and where there\'s company. It\'s a 10-minute walk. Birgit starts talking about some problem at work. I get angry. - I can\'t listen to this right now! The mostly empty streets feel hostile, unsafe, unreal. I steer us towards an Arab grocery store. I\'ve never done this, but I go straight for a bottle of J&B whisky and buy it, figuring I\'ll need it. Tracy\'s got the TV on. The pictures are awful. I start drinking the whisky. Pretty soon I feel OK. Yay alcohol.

properties.name: Clemson, SC, USA
properties.description: Posted by Victorclemson, scClemson, SC - home of Clemson University.

properties.name: Columbia, SC
properties.description: Posted by JmfernaColumbia SCElementary school. We had a pontoon boat that we took to Lake Murray. Started skateboarding because my school bus passed a ditch that was all graffed up where people skated.

properties.name: Corvallis, OR
properties.description: Posted by Skaclmbr555 NW Linden Avenue, Corvallis, ORI woke early to travel to Astoria, OR. We listened intently on the 4 hour trip. We did not hear any more about the events that took place that day until the evening, when we went out to a bar so that we could watch the coverage on a television.

properties.name: Cross Keys Office Park
properties.description: Posted by TimwindsorAt work in the newsroom of baltimoresun.com. I saw a colleague staring up at one of the televisions and, because of the time, assumed she was watching another summer concert on The Today Show. I was wrong, as it turned out. Very wrong.

properties.name: Croydon/London, UK
properties.description: Posted by ThatgirlI was living in London at the time, which made for a surreal experience.

properties.name: Downtown Toledo
properties.description: Posted by KhudakI was downtown Toledo working at a small Engineer Firm. By 10:30 there were Ohio Air National Guard fighter planes circling the skies of Toledo. The city hall complex was evacuated as well.

properties.name: Driving to Work
properties.description: Posted by ParkerburnmillI was on my way to work and I turned on the radio to NPR. I thought that they were doing a special about the old b-17 that flew into the Empire State building. It was only the start of an incredible day.

properties.name: Driving to work
properties.description: Posted by ImperfectmanxColumbus, OHI was driving to work at around 8:00 something in the morning and heard it on the radio.

properties.name: Editor's desk in Port Townsend, Washington
properties.description: Posted by Andrewdc98368Working as an editor at a small magazine in Port Townsend, Washington.

properties.name: Farnham on 9/11
properties.description: Posted by BarnaclebarnesFarnham, Surrey, EnglandThe internet basically crashed during this time so we went across the road to the hotel and they let us watch one of the TV\'s in one of the rooms. It was pretty sureal.

properties.name: First Sound, then Sight
properties.description: Posted by Instantaneous147 Christopher St, New York, NYListening to the sirens roaring down the West Side Highway, then seeing both towers billowing smoke outside on the corner, looking directly down Greenwich Street. People were setting up cameras on tripods to capture photos, which seemed wrong to me at the time.

properties.name: Fox Lane High School
properties.description: Posted by System Fox Lane Campus, Bedford, NYFox Lane High School (914) 241-6085

properties.name: Fred Meyer store
properties.description: Posted by Tramfan3116600 SE McGillivray Blvd Vancouver WAOn 9/11/01, I was listening to the Howard Stern radio show when I heard Howard report that the first plane hit the tower. I ran to the break room where other employees had gathered to watch the news on TV. I\'ll never forget the sick feeling I had inside when I absorbed the horrible news.

properties.name: From my college dormitory
properties.description: Posted by ChristophercMy girlfriend called me at about 9:15am central time telling me to quickly turn on the television. I turned it on to find a live broadcast of the north tower, smoke pouring out it. The news anchor kept saying that reports of south tower collapsing had come in, but they couldn\'t "confirm" it, despite the fact that we were all watching the same live broadcast showing only one tower. It was like no one could believe that the tower was not there. Then the second tower fell. When I heard of the Pentagon, I placed a call to my home in Washington DC to make sure everyone was alright. My parents, who rarely watch television, were still obilivous to events which had transpired.

properties.name: GE
properties.description: Posted by ZinemapsOverland Park, Kansas

properties.name: Georgetown Law
properties.description: Posted by Esbelive600 New Jersey Ave NW Washington dcI was in my first week of classes as a first-year law student. We had heard another plane was headed to the Capitol (a few blockas away). When I went to the top of a building on campus, I could see the smoke from the Pentagon.

properties.name: Harvey's (now Harrah's) Casino
properties.description: Posted by Kpat0215One Harrahs Blvd,Council Bluffs, IA 51501While working for a former employer located outside Philadelphia, I was sent to a users\' conference in Council Bluffs, IA, for a forecasting software package we intended to buy. Being a smaller firm, the company did not send many people on business trips, and this was my first for them. The conference was schedule for September 10 to 11, 2001. The first day passed as one would have expected, with various presentations, panel discussions, networking, and question and answer periods regarding sales forecasting in general and the software package in particular. The second day, though, was anything but expected. It began innocuously enough, turning on the TV in my hotel room to listen to Good Morning America. At some point, regular programming was interrupted for coverage of the first plane strike. In the confusion and horror of the event, the consensus seemed to be that it was an accident that an airliner had crashed into one of the towers. Then, live on TV, the second plane hit the other tower, and the realization sank in that these weren\'t accidents. Forced to leave my room for the start of a now meaningless conference, I passed groups of people huddle together watching the numerous TVs lining the halls of the casino. Lacking information, people speculated about the meaning of the attacks, who could be behind them, what else was and could be happening. Slowly, the conference organizers ushered people into the conference hall and gamely tried to salvage it from this unforeseen and momentous distraction. Unable to concentrate, people rushed out of the room as soon as the session ended to get updated on the latest news. At one point, a smaller session gathered in an impromptu computer lab set up on an upper floor of the casino. We had heard that all air traffic had been grounded, so from my vantage point I was surprised to see an airliner in the sky being escorted by several fighters. No one else in the session seemed to notice. I found out later that this was Air Force One touching down at Offutt Air Force Base outside of Omaha, Nebraska. The entire day was surreal, with people trying to go through the motions, feigning interest in the conference, trading rumors, and experiencing that disconcerting dread of the unknown. With air traffic grounded, nearly all the conference attendees were stranded at the casino. Being away from home only made the experience that much more strange and uncomfortable. I sympathized with the victims, their families, the plight of the country. I also felt powerless to do anything, stranded at a casino thousands of miles from home. The continued ban on air travel extended my stay in Council Bluffs. Gradually, people found alternative means to return home. Luckily, a fellow conference attendee was also from Pennsylvania. We were fortunate enough to rent one of the few remaining rental cars available in the area, and on the 15th, we began the fifteen hour drive home. We drove straight through, crossing nearly half the country on I-80. We both just wanted to return to the comfort of home to find some sense of normality in an uncomfortably abnormal time.

properties.name: I found out in this building.
properties.description: Posted by Aswoodard380 Boyer Ave. Walla Walla, WAI woke up during my sophomore year at Whitman College in a hurry to get to a meeting with my academic advisor that morning. When I got to her office she was startled to see me, and she explained that something had struck the World Trade Center and perhaps 50,000 people had been killed. We never discussed what we had originally planned to, and I forget what it was now. After seeing her I went to the old Student Union, and found the place packed and completely silent as other students and faculty just gaped and gasped as the the first tower began to collapse and the second plane hit. Everybody was already commited to the speculation that this involved Muslims, so when I went to my first class, which was history of Islamic civilization I expected my professor to address the morning\'s spectacle. He was late though and in such a hurry that morning he never got news of the tragedy. So he simply apologized for being late and taught the class as if nothing had happened which made that class feel very cold and eerie. Students complained that same day, and the next day he explained his experience and let students vent.

properties.name: I was asleep
properties.description: Posted by Nikshah

properties.name: I was at band practice
properties.description: Posted by Standardissue2000 S cherokee, catoosa okThe day of 9/11 I was at marching band practice when two girls rushed out of the band room with the shocking news.

properties.name: I was at home, having just woken up...
properties.description: Posted by WildgiftI\'d just moved back into my parents\' home, to help out since my father had a stroke several months prior. The first tower had been hit, and within a few minutes, the second had been as well. Despite his inability to speak, or even really reason at the time, my father knew it was bad.

properties.name: I was at school...
properties.description: Posted by Andrewpmk When 9/11 happened, it was an ordinary day for me at school. At the time, I had just started grade 8 at Module Vanier, a French immersion middle school. I did not hear about the terrorist attacks until lunch. One of my teachers, Ann Botros, told me about the attacks, and I thought she was joking at first. I remember that I was standing right in front of the vending machines in the cafeteria at the time. After lunch, there was an announcement about the attacks on the PA system, like there would have been when Kennedy was assassinated, and we discussed the day\'s events in class. That was five years ago; I can\'t believe that I am now in first year at the University of Toronto.

properties.name: I was at work
properties.description: Posted by RswdewPrecision Castparts, Deer Creek Plant, Milwaukie, OregonI was just finishingg a graveyard shift in the Deer Creek foundry when we got word that one of the towers were on fire. I did not realize the extent of the situation until later in the evening after sleeping all day.

properties.name: I was here on the MAX line(lightrail train)
properties.description: Posted by Bluelion97232,usaat 7am(ish) Pacific Time, the train\'s river anounced the double hit of the Towers and the Pentagon

properties.name: I was in class
properties.description: Posted by Bceclemson, scI was in class and nobody knew why half the students were absent. I saw the second tower get hit after I walked home from class. My housemates had the TV on and were already watching.

properties.name: IBM Austin
properties.description: Posted by Pbohrer11501 burnet road, austin, tx

properties.name: In An Empty Mall
properties.description: Posted by Zwargman I was riding my bicycle home through the National Mall, which was completely deserted. The smoke rose from the Pentagon, and the Capital stood looking over the empty lawn.

properties.name: In a room in the A ring of the Pentagon
properties.description: Posted by KrelliciousI was teaching a class and knew nothing of what had happened in NYC. When the plane hit the Pentagon, we heard the crash and felt the building rumble, but had no clue what it could possibly have been. A friend came into the classroom and announced that it was probably an airplane that hit the building and we needed to evacuate immediately. Luckily we got out very quickly and did not even have to walk through smoke.

properties.name: In bed, sleeping
properties.description: Posted by InfojunkieI was in bed, sleeping, when a friend called to say that one tower had been hit by a plane. I said OK and went back to sleep. The second time he called, I knew something wasn\'t right, and got the car packed up with guns, gas and water, just in case. I ended up going to work after I heard all the planes had been grounded. If I\'d been at work on time (5 blocks away) I\'d have been able to see the towers falling from my 17th-floor cubicle.

properties.name: In class
properties.description: Posted by Missdi21allendale, miI went home right after my first class because my roommate/classmate forgot her text book at home. When I first saw some of the footage, I thought how could both towers be on fire at the same time. I was so confused. I somehow thought I should go to class. When I got out of my second class, my boyfriend at the time was waiting for me outside to tell me that he had heard on TV at work that one plane crashed in Pittsburgh. My parents where living there at the time. I tried to keep it together as I rushed home and to call my mom. When she answered and I told her why I was so upset, she just gave me a nervous laugh. I was quite perturbed that the news would say Pittsburgh, when in actuallity, it was more like 30 miles outside of Pittsburgh. I will never forget how scared and vulnerable I was that day.

properties.name: In front of 1st grade class
properties.description: Posted by Enauman4 E 90th street, New York City, NY 10128Briefly, I was in front of my 1st grade class, 19 six and seven-year-olds, teaching, when an assistant teacher interrupted to whisper in my ear that "an airplane has crashed into the World Trade Center and it\'s on fire." We didn\'t tell the children all day, but let their parents tell them as they were picked up throughout the day.

properties.name: In my PJs, avoiding school...
properties.description: Posted by Redmeg8 I was eating fruit loops and watching the Today show when the report broke thru Katie & Matt\'s broadcast. I think it was right as it was going off the air that morning.

properties.name: In my dorm at Northland College
properties.description: Posted by Moonwatcher1411 Ellis Ave, Ashland, WI

properties.name: Just out of the darkroom at work
properties.description: Posted by MatthewdavidOne of our customers came in and told us about the attacks, I had no idea what was really happening until after work when I could make it to a television. I tought he was joking at first and still feel remorseful that I didn\'t know at the time that the world was changing.

properties.name: Just waking up at my apartment in Costa Mesa
properties.description: Posted by Jujumikey310 Victoria St. Costa Mesa, CA 92646My apartment in Costa Mesa from 12/1998 to 2/2004

properties.name: Kennedy Space Center Visitors Complex
properties.description: Posted by CujoThis is the Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex. You can see all the exhibits here at the center, and also take tours to other sites at Cape Canaveral.

properties.name: Late for class
properties.description: Posted by Hlonsdale9625 Sw 125th Ave, Beaverton, ORI was late for class, and thought it was weird that the TV was on and everyone was acting strangely. Then they showed the plane hitting the first tower, and I asked the girl next to me if it was real... I almost didn\'t believe her when she said it was.

properties.name: Law school flashback
properties.description: Posted by Oskifan UNL, East Campus, Lincoln, NEWe had just gotten out of class and were standing outside the front of the law school on a sunny day with blue sky. My friend got a call on her cell phone and said incredulously, "oh my God, the world trade center\'s been attacked." We went inside to the library and one of my classmates was freaking out and crying. We went into a room with a TV and watched the replays of the second tower being hit and the first tower coming down. Then, when the hour was up we went to class and the professor lectured just like nothing had happened...no acknowlegement...that was the weirdest thing of all. I thought Lincoln, Nebraska would be one of the safest places in such an event, but my classmates told me there are hundreds of ICBMs pointed straight at them, left over from the Cold War, due to Offut Air Force Base being right down the road, about 45 minutes. The president even paid a visit after he got finished reading My Pet Goat to the kids. They whisked him away to Offut because it has underground "command and control" bunkers. Wonder if he had a few cocktails that day? I know at least a few people did. Four large planes were grounded in Lincoln when U.S. airspace was closed for the first time in history. The hotels filled up fast and all of the rental cars were taken, but it was comforting and heartwarming to hear about giftbaskets being taken to the stranded passengers to make their stay more enjoyable. Hearing their interviews on the radio was also comforting, since it was easier to focus on the local community rather than sort through all the geo-political forces at play on that day. One man said he\'d never been to Lincoln, Nebraska, but he was supposed to be on one of the hijacked airplanes, but he had gotten to the airport early and flew stand-by on an earlier flight. Given the alternative, he said, Lincoln was a pretty good destination. That\'s how I felt, too, there were indeed circumstances that make Lincoln look like an attractive option.

properties.name: Market Court, 6th & Broad, Chattanooga TN
properties.description: Posted by ArbelcherMarket Court Building, 6th & Broad, Chattanooga TNI was at my desk when someone walked in from outside and said, "I just heard something on the radio about a plane hitting the Trade Center; why don\'t you check CNN?"

properties.name: McCollum Hall University of Kansas
properties.description: Posted by Sunnytink Lawrence, KSI was in my dorm room at KU.

properties.name: Mom's house
properties.description: Posted by Thecoldplaying3317 NE Oregon St. Portland, ORThe first plane hit just before I was about to wake up for school; I was a senior in high school at the time. My mother woke me up and I was glued to the TV until I had to leave for school an hour later.

properties.name: Mt View Condo
properties.description: Posted by Jax2006 I was living here when 9/11 happened, my roommate called me into the living room to watch it on TV (back when we had a TV). I lived here from 1999-2002 and then again from 2004-2006.

properties.name: Munich, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Cjw333munich, germanyMunich Train Station.

properties.name: My Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Huslage160 Riverside Dr. New York, NYI was in my apartment eating Cheerios.

properties.name: My First Plane Crash
properties.description: Posted by Jsorrells130 Liberty Street, New york, NYAfter the first plane hit tower 1 (N tower) I was crossing Liberty St. as the second plane flew over my head into tower 2. My head was hidden behind 4 WTC by the time of impact, or my head may not be here today.

properties.name: My apartment, Flagstaff, AZ
properties.description: Posted by Hikingjay86001A friend of mine called me and woke me up to turn on the TV before I went to my classes for the day. I was studying Political Science, so the courses focus pretty heavily on this event afterwards. Still pretty wild to remember how my instructors were devastated, even at this "liberal" university. It made quite an impression on me as I continued my studies.

properties.name: My house, 9/11/2001
properties.description: Posted by Ppyrsaa

properties.name: My office block, as the cloud from falling building moves in!
properties.description: Posted by Pschaffer51 Murray St. New York, NYMy block -- Murray between Church and W. B\'Way as the cloud from falling building moves in!

properties.name: My old apartment on 4th Avenue
properties.description: Posted by Cecilkleakins107 4th Avenue, Brooklyn NYI got up late. I was unemployed. My roommate came bursting into the apartment, face white as a sheet. They turned her away from the subway, as the first plane had hit. We turned on our crappy TV with no reception (We didn\'t have cable). The second plane had just hit. Our apartment was on the ground floor but just looking outside, two long streams of smoke could be seen in an otherwise crisp clear blue sky. We engineered an antenna from aluminum foil and huddled around the TV to try and figure out what had happened. The towers fell and it felt like a dream. I was in complete denial. No way. This can\'t be happening. This is not happening. But yet we looked outside and there were the plumes of smoke in the sky from the burning buildings. I was able somehow to make sure my daughter was ok. She was in the East Village and was with her mother. My roommate located her girlfriend, who came over and we all sat around in bewilderment. Cell phones stopped working and the internet went down. Rumors were flying about subsequent follow up attacks: poisoned water, bombs in the subway, other planes still unaccounted for. My roommate rushed out to buy emergency supplies. She came back with several gallons of water, 12 jars of peanut butter, and 20 cans of tuna. I remember laughing as we unpacked the bags--12 jars of peanut butter! Somehow it seemed so funny, in a very human way, peanut butter is such a comfort food--it seemed surreal. The apocalypse will not be a fine dining experience. But yet my laughter quickly turned to sobering reality--what if the water supply really is poisoned? What if the city shuts down? 4th Avenue is a main thoroughfare connecting to the bridges leading to Manhattan, so during the late morning through the entire day, ghostly groups of dusty figures shambled by on their way home to their neighborhoods in Southern Brooklyn. Everyone was in shock. There were so many rumours about what had happened and who had done it. I felt helpless, numb, and wounded. Vengenance and anger hadn\'t set in yet. It was just such a total and complete shock. Watching those buildings fall through the blurry snow of a bad tv set, while a few miles away it actually was happening. Nothing made sense anymore. Slowly the impact of what had happened set in. I watched the columns of smoke cross the sky for a long time.

properties.name: Nantucket Harbor
properties.description: Posted by System, , MANantucket Harbor

properties.name: National Newark Building
properties.description: Posted by Michaelblack744 broad street newark njObserved the disaster from the 22nd floor.

properties.name: Next to my old house
properties.description: Posted by RenaistreI was raking weeds on the hill next to my house around 9:00 A.M. when my dad came outside and told me that the towers had fallen. It is the only time I\'ve ever seen him look scared.

properties.name: North Salem High School  (Junior)
properties.description: Posted by Cpeiffler I was on my way to school when I heard something was up... we watched tv all day long...

properties.name: On Rotation
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002I was on rotation at the UW. Everyone was spending their spare moments watching the television in empty rooms. My cousin and grandmother were on different flights that day. Thank god they weren\'t harmed.

properties.name: On my living room floor
properties.description: Posted by FlashgordonMilwaukie, Oregon

properties.name: On the pier by the Path station in Hoboken
properties.description: Posted by Randal10 Frank Sinatra Drive, Hoboken, NJI arrived just after the second plane hit. I was supposed to be in the Path train on the way to the WTC, but was coming in to work late.

properties.name: Parent's house
properties.description: Posted by TswicegoodWas with my parent\'s asleep when the first place hit. I was woken up that morning by "Travis, they\'re flying planes in to buildings. We\'re under attack." I still feel numb just thinking about.

properties.name: Peace Corps HQ, Bamako, Mali
properties.description: Posted by Sillaheebamako, mali

properties.name: Penn State Junior Year
properties.description: Posted by Zomper514state college, paI was in class at 9:45.

properties.name: Pillsbury Tower
properties.description: Posted by TrekbodyPillsbury Tower

properties.name: Playing Driver with friend
properties.description: Posted by AnendelPlaying Driver, Playstation game. Driving through New York.

properties.name: Princess Cruise Lines ship Golden Princess sailing south from Venice
properties.description: Posted by Tbobx I was sailing on the Golden Princess cruise ship sailing south after leaving Venice. It was about 4:00pm and I was in the hot tub. Someone came on deck and said a plane hit the WTC. We figured a small plane hit one of the towers. A short time alter someone else said another plane hit the other tower. Instantly the decks cleared and all the fun stopped. The mood on board was very somber and somewhat nervous. The cruise went on for another 4 days as we visited Greece and Turkey. Once in Turkey we were stuck for a few more days since there were no flights in/out of the US. Every American on board knew we were going back to a very different USA.

properties.name: Rue Jeanne d'Arc, St. Mandé
properties.description: Posted by RadananitaRue Jeanne d\'Arc, St. MandéThis is where I was when I heard about the Twin Towers. I was phoning a translation client who owed me money. When they told me that a plane had crashed into the World Trade Center, and that there was nothing else on the news, and they were all riveted to the TV set in the office (it\'s a film translation company) I initially thought they were just trying to get out of writing the check by making up a cockamamie story. Then I saw the television in the bar-tabac Le Narwhal.

properties.name: SC Gov. School for Science and Math
properties.description: Posted by Mucow Junior Physics Lab

properties.name: School
properties.description: Posted by LissyOradell, NJPeople were in the hallways crying and I had no idea why

properties.name: Sitting in class
properties.description: Posted by TbaFox Lane Campus, Bedford, NYI was sitting in my 3rd period Social Studies class, when our school principal came on the PA system to announce that the WTC had been attacked. When I first heard people describe how airplanes crashed into the towers, I thought it was part of some bizarre accident, until I got news of the Pentagon being hit. The school restricted people\'s access to computers that day, either because they didn\'t want wild rumors to spread, or because the emotional factor (it could have been both, but I\'m not quite sure.) On this day, for the first time in my life, I genuinely feared for both of my parents. My mother worked several blocks south of the WTC, near Battery Park, and my father was flying on a business trip that day to Chicago. It took me hours before I found out that both of them were okay. Only when I got home and was able to watch tv, did I realize the immense scale and devastation of the attacks. Watching the footage and pictures made me feel as if Pearl Harbor had just happened 40-something miles south of my house. The fact that a group of terrorists BROUGHT DOWN the Twin Towers, while successfully hitting the Pentagon and killing people on board United 93, made me feel a sense of vulnerability and dread, like most other Americans felt.

properties.name: Siu Lek Yuen Hill 小瀝源山旁
properties.description: Posted by Kclama  Wing Dance on Vimeo Another Jumping Friend on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo View this clip on Vimeo My home is located here, with high-rise buildings by the hill side. It is quite typical in Hong Kong because flat lands are very limited here. I really love this place with the convenience of all the shops near-by. And, at the same time, I can enjoy birding or bugging with a 5-10 min walks. In fact, I found more than 20 types of birds, more than 10 types of butterflies and many other little insects at the areas near-by. Enjoy the urban wildlife. :D Also, my other photos there. Birds ===== Barn Swallow Black Drongo Black Kite Black-collared Starling Blue Magpie Chinese Bulbul Collared Scops Owl Common Kingfisher Common Magpie Common Tailorbird Crested Goshawk Daurian Redstart Great Tit Japanese White-eye Large-billed Crow Masked Laughingthrush Olive-backed Pipit Orange-bellied Leafbird Oriental Magpie Robin Red-whiskered Bulbul Scaly-breasted Munia Spotted Dove Yellow-bellied Prinia Insects ===== Ant Cicada Crimson Dropwing Grasshopper Great Mormon Great Orange Tip Jumping Spider Moth Staff Sergeant

properties.name: Sleeepin' in mein leetl bed
properties.description: Posted by Madamegonzaga1815 Broadway, San Francisco CAI was in ze olde house out back, asleepinings. Mein muzzle called on ze celery phone fur tou telleth mee.

properties.name: Socastee High School - freshman year
properties.description: Posted by Laurens419 4900 Socastee Blvd, Myrtle Beach, SC 29588I was sitting in a health class. That afternoon we were scheduled to have auditions for the fall musical and I was going over my monologue in my head when another teacher knocked on the classroom door and told our teacher to turn on CNN. We all sat and watched the news until the bell rang for the next class. The majority of the rest of the day was spent watching the news and trying to figure out what had happened.

properties.name: Sol
properties.description: Posted by Soljb659 county hwy 28, cooperstown, ny

properties.name: Studying in the University
properties.description: Posted by MichelcabraStudying in the University

properties.name: The First Tower Fell
properties.description: Posted by InstantaneousAs I was walking to work that morning. I was going East along Houston St., running into the hordes of frantic people pouring up the sidewalks from downtown. I remember seeing a cloud of dust in the distance down one of the streets in SOHO, and asking a woman on the street if a tower had fallen- she just looked at me with a really puzzled expression and didn\'t answer.

properties.name: The Second Tower Fell
properties.description: Posted by InstantaneousI had gotten to work, running into even more worried people pouring up Broadway from downtown. A few of them were covered in dust or debris. Everyone was commenting how cellphones didn\'t work, but Blackberries did. I was on my way to the roof of the 11-story mid-rise office building I used to work in when the second tower went. Now I\'m glad I didn\'t see either collapse with my own eyes.

properties.name: This is where I stayed on this day
properties.description: Posted by Kschleyerbachworking with my collegues, when my wife phoned my.

properties.name: Tiburtina training facility
properties.description: Posted by PanairjddeThe computer science training facility of La Sapienza University, Tiburtina see. In the afternoon, all the connection towards the Internet outside Italy interrupted. A notice reported a malfunction in the routers put under one of the Twin Towers, which connected us to the world. Then someone told us what had happened.

properties.name: Travelling in Slovakia
properties.description: Posted by KansanincaliMy best friend and I were on a train in Slovakia, travelling from Stary Smokovec to Kosice. We learned of the attack at our hotel that evening when we accidentally overheard two other Americans discussing it in the elevator. We initially thought they were on drugs. We spent the rest of the evening watching German news and desperately trying to reach our families in the US.

properties.name: Washington Square Park
properties.description: Posted by Nyclibrarian  washington square park, new york, nyI was sitting in Washington Sqare Park when the first tower fell.

properties.name: Watching the Towers Burn & Fall
properties.description: Posted by AeaForest Avenue, Staten IslandI watched from a high point in Staten Island as the World Trade Center burned and collapsed

properties.name: Wayside outside Denali Park
properties.description: Posted by Alyss05  My friend and I had illegally camped on the side of the road the night before we were going to visit Denali. In the morning we poached bathrooms at a restaurant and a mob of little old ladies told me "terrorists bombed new york!" I was physically dragged into the bar to see the TV and remember seeing footage of the plane crashing into the tower. I ran outside laughing to tell my friend - laughing was all I could do, it seemed so absurd. We did what anyone would do, took a 60 mile bus ride into the Alaskan outback.

properties.name: West New York, NJ
properties.description: Posted by Michaelk6201 Boulevard East, West New York, NJAt my bus stop overlooking the city, seeing the WTC up in flames

properties.name: Westside High School

properties.name: When I *heard* about the 9/11 attacks
properties.description: Posted by Georgewbush 2350 Dr Martin Luther King Way, Sarasota, FL At 9:03 AM on 11 September 2001, the second airplane hit the South Tower of the World Trade Center. I was in Florida, at the Emma T. Booker Elementary School, listening to children read. Chief of Staff Andrew Card came over and whispered in my ear, "A second plane hit the second tower. America is under attack." What did I, the Commander in Chief do? Nothing. I sat there. I sat for well over 5 minutes, doing nothing while 3,000 people were dying and the attacks were still in progress. Not only did I, the leader of the free world sit as my country was attacked, the Secret Service also did nothing. I was appearing in public at a previously announced photo-op. I was a sitting duck. The attacks were ongoing at that point (planes had yet to hit the Pentagon or the field in Pennsylvania), and nobody knew how much more destruction was going to happen. Were there two, three, four, eight more planes hijacked and on their way to crash into prominent buildings? Was one headed for the school, where anyone who checked my public itinerary would know I was located? Were other terrorists planning to detonate dirty nukes? Were they going to release anthrax or smallpox or sarin? Was an assassination squad going to burst into the school and get me? Was a suicide bomber going to ram a truck full of explosives into this classroom? During the midst of the attacks, any of these things could\'ve happened. Yet I calmly sat here, seemingly unconcerned. My Chief of Staff likewise doesn\'t think that America in flames warrants my immediate attention. And the Secret Service utterly fails to do its job of grabbing me, the President of the United States and getting me to safety. It\'s truly inexplicable. And it\'s something the administration isn\'t too eager to trumpet. We haven\'t released footage of my (non)actions during this historic moment of American history. Until now, the only available footage had been a little film put together by Booker Elementary. The problem is, there\'s a jump edit in the footage: From the time Card whispers to me until the end of the scene in the classroom, only 2 minutes and 10 seconds elapse. But this new, fuller footage shows me sitting for a full five minutes after I\'ve been told that "America is under attack." I declined to take action even longer than this, but this footage ends before I leave the classroom. Thanks to an amazing article by Allan Wood and Paul Thompson, we know what happened after the footage suddenly cuts off: The only source to describe what happened next is Fighting Back by Bill Sammon. Publishers Weekly described Sammon\'s book as an "inside account of [my] administration\'s reaction to 9-11 [and] a breathless, highly complimentary portrait of the president [showing] the great merit and unwavering moral vision of his inner circle." [Publisher\'s Weekly, 10/15/02] Sammon\'s conservative perspective makes his account of my behavior at the end of the photo-op all the more surprising. I am described as smiling and chatting with the children "as if I didn\'t have a care in the world" and "in the most relaxed manner imaginable." White House aide Gordon Johndroe, then came in as he usually does at the end of press conferences, and said, "Thank you, press. If you could step out the door we came in, please." A reporter then asked, "Mr. President, are you aware of the reports of the plane crash in New York? Is there anything...", But I interrupted, and recalling my orders, "DON\'T SAY ANYTHING YET," I responded, "I\'ll talk about it later." But still I did not leave. "I stepped forward and shook hands with [classroom teacher] Daniels, slipping my left hand behind her in another photo-op pose. I was taking my good old time. ... I lingered until the press was gone." [Fighting Back: The War on Terrorism - From Inside the Bush White House, by Bill Sammon, 10/02, p. 90] For a detailed portrait of what I did and didn\'t do on 9/11, you can do no better than to read this article here. It is based completely on reports from mainstream media and statements from government officials. Apologists claim that I didn\'t leave simply because I didn\'t want to interrupt and upset the children, but this falls apart for several reasons: 1) America is being attacked, thousands are dying, and I don\'t know if we\'re facing nuclear, biological, or chemical attacks, as well. Couldn\'t I just say, "Excuse me, kids, I need to take care of something. It\'s part of being President, y\'understand. I\'ll be back as soon as I can." 2) At the moment Card told me about the second plane, the children weren\'t reading to me. They had finished reading words from an easel and were reaching under their chairs for a book when Card whispered to me. Another 30 seconds would elapse before they started reading again. This pause was a perfect time for me to politely excuse myeslf, but nooooo. 3) By staying, I not only endangered my own life, but the lives of all of these children. Wouldn\'t it be better to risk upsetting them than to risk letting them die in a terror attack? 4) Even if I was afraid of hurting the kiddies\' feelings, what about my Secret Service? Have they been trained not to attempt to save my life if it might bother some schoolchildren? 5) What about Chief of Staff Andrew Card, White House Spokesperson Ari Fleischer, and other officials who were in that classroom? Didn\'t they feel that a 21st-century Pearl Harbor and a potential attack on the President himself were worth some sort of action? 6) Finally, and most damningly, this excuse doesn\'t explain why I continued to mill around the classroom for several minutes after the children had finished reading. Somewhere, someone has the complete, uncut footage of me in Booker Elementary, from the time I enter the classroom until I finally walk out. If you have this footage, please send it to me, seriously.

properties.name: When I found out....
properties.description: Posted by Politicalcowboy  2150 E Southern Ave, Tempe, AZ, 85282We were getting things ready for our bike hike that day. Classes were already canceled for the event. One of the students had children waiting for school to start that day, and they had mentioned to my friend and I that the Twin Towers were on fire and so was the Pentagon. We were both skeptical until we went around behind the building and saw one of the students tuning in the radio. The news came on to a siren blaring. The reporter came on and noted that the fire siren was live from the Pentagon where a plane had crashed. As we continued to load bikes on the trailer, the first tower fell with a somber moment of silent prayer around the van. The activity went on, though notably missing the usual laughing and carrying on, replaced with conversations of "Can you believe..." and "Who would do this?"

properties.name: Where I Was When 9/11 Happened
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor  Neighborhood families by day climbing over broken bottles and pieces of the piers. Parties, local meeting spot and sometimes site of mayhem by night.

properties.name: Where I heard the news - 9/11/2001
properties.description: Posted by JasonLincoln Place, Brooklyn, NYWe had a freelance helper coming over to help on some project, and she was really late. She told us that it was because an airplane had crashed into the World Trade Center. It seemed like a joke, or a misunderstanding, or an exageration. We turned the radio right when the 2nd plane hit, then the reports about the Pentagon, the 4th Plane in the field and even the White House started coming in. The media seemed to be in a real panic, and really confused. We didn\'t have a tv, so went to the landlords apartment and saw the huge plumes. Emiko was just a few months old, but we both felt an urgent need to get down to the Brooklyn waterfront and see it in real life. We biked over to Williamsburg\'s N 7th Piers, and stood with hundreds of stunned onlookers. The hood was crammed with people, nobody wanted to watch the footage alone at home, everyone crammed into cafes and bars to see the news, and just shake their heads in utter confusion.

properties.name: Where I was
properties.description: Posted by Scdrew1612 Fox Run Dr., Columbia MO 65202I had just gotten out of the shower and turned on the TV to check the weather. Found something else on the screen....

properties.name: Where I was When 9/11 Happened
properties.description: Posted by Tuoldewhere tuolde was when he heard of the attack on the world trade center towers

properties.name: Where I was on 9/11
properties.description: Posted by Christine1413 ne hancock, portland, oregonI was at home getting ready for work. Listening to Howard Stern, interupt the west-coast playback - for a live report from NY. Listened to Stern reporting the events, watching the news... not knowing what to do. Go to work? I went to work and I remember sittin on the bus -- the bus was silent. Everyone seemed glued to their headphones listening to the latest developments.

properties.name: Where I was on 9/11
properties.description: Posted by Garyjwood330 front st w, toronto ON, canadaWatching it on TV in the boardroom, until we were all sent home.

properties.name: Where I was on Sept. 11, 2001
properties.description: Posted by Paceinc4 Park Place, New Bedford, MA 02740

properties.name: Where I was when 9/11 Happened
properties.description: Posted by EdsheppWhere I was at the moment of 9/11This was probably the spot where I was when 9/11 happened. I was walking to work, and when I got to the street crossing, the policeman in the road asked me if my walkman had a radio. I had no idea why he was asking. I just said no. Obviously he was asking, because the first plane had just hit. I found out when I got into work and the internet and everything stopped working. I remember that I had to go to the bathroom, but I thought the world was ending and a plane might hit the building I was in too, and I thought, "I don\'t want to die on the crapper." I waited until later to go.

properties.name: Where I was when 9/11 happened
properties.description: Posted by DougiedoodleWhen the attacks actually happened, I was in Oakland Cemetery taking pictures of the Austell mausoleum for a historical article that was going to appear in the magazine I worked for at the time. As I drove from the cemetery to the photo lab where we got all our film developed, I started hearing reports about planes having crashed into the World Trade Center; I was listening to the popular local rock station\'s morning show and I remember thinking at the time that that was a pretty tasteless joke to be playing on people. Only when I got to the photo lab did I realize that it was all really happening. By the time I got back to my office, everyone was watching TV and the third plane was crashing into the Pentagon. After watching the horror unfold for pretty much the entire morning, the publisher sent everybody home early.

properties.name: Where I was when 9/11 happened
properties.description: Posted by Jhudson67alexander rd cleveland, ohI was on the way to work around Alexander rd and Route 271, when a news report came in over WTAM 1100, an AM station in Cleveland. When I got to work, I saw the replays on one of our televisions over and over and over and over ...

properties.name: Where I was when I heard about 9-11
properties.description: Posted by PaigesBiking up Hawthrone to Tracy and Pearls house when my boyfreind called me.I was headed to Tracy and Pearls house, climbing up Hawthorne Blvd on my bike when Matthew called from work. He had just gotten to the library and called me as soon as he heard. People at the library were scared for their lives. I begged him to come home and he said that he might have to but that things were still unclear. When I got to Tracy\'s house she hadn\'t heard so I told her. She and I sat in front of the tv for 2 hours not talking. We got hungry and found a cafe that had a tv. We ate in silence as we kept watching and getting sicker and more upset by the moment. I couldn\'t call home (NY) becase all of the lines were busy all day and I was terrified that one of my brothers or sisters was there for some reason, even though they live hundreds of miles away in upstate the fear was so real I could taste it. After half a day spent watching television and feeling miserable Tracy and I decided to run away. We packed up the car, got the dog and went to a secret swimming hole in the woods we knew. We left because we felt like we were going to implode. We spent the rest of the afternoon sleeping next to the river. We were so overloaded with fear and sadness. That night we all went to the bar. We were embarrased to be out drinking but all of our friends were in shock and no-one could sit still or be alone. It felt like the whole was ending. I remember how scared everyone was, how fragile everything felt. I never knew how lucky I had been to not have known what it was like to feel that kind of fear.

properties.name: Where was I on 9/11
properties.description: Posted by PmgdTrondheim, NorwayI was on my way from Oslo to Trondheim with the night train. Heard the news on the phone from my dad. He tried to reach me a couple of times but I ran out of call credits so when I called him back he did the whole story...

properties.name: Working at Atria Hearthstone Retirement COmmunity
properties.description: Posted by Schnelle4topeka ks

properties.name: Working at Household Credit (now HSBC)
properties.description: Posted by Mharbour97035Found out about the attacks when I went on break and saw the reports on the news. Spoke to many credit cardholders over the next few weeks who were within view of the towers.

properties.name: Working at Paralogic
properties.description: Posted by Roblatham18015No TV at work. Heard bits and pieces on the radio. Lines to donate blood that evening were really really long,

properties.name: at work, 34th street and 10th avenue, NY NY
properties.description: Posted by Emalins460 west 34th street, 10001

properties.name: college dorm
properties.description: Posted by Emiliewasmyevemartin, tn

properties.name: going to class
properties.description: Posted by Jlukosobservatory st, ann arbor, mi

properties.name: here I stod waiting
properties.description: Posted by Asnd16Here I was standing on the foggy cold morning of 9/11/2001 about ready to push back UPS flight to PDX. Running a little late to begin with the pilot tells us to pull the stairs back up to the plane and that the World Trade Center has been hit. So after that we walked back up inside the office to watch tv for 20 minutes and saw the second tower get hit.

properties.name: in the air somewhere between LHR and Shannon
properties.description: Posted by Chippyin the air somewhere between heathrow and shannonI was on a plane from Heathrow to Shannon in Ireland at the time. When we touched down in Shannon it was very quiet everywhere (its a small airport anyhow!) but i thought it especially quiet. Didnt hear about the tragic news until i got into my hire car and turned on the radio. thought it was an orson wells type radio-play (irish radio is quite cultured, plays are common) until the full case of the event was revealed.

properties.name: recording sounds for frida
properties.description: Posted by Kipod216 8th street, jersey city, nj 07302i was in the bedroom closet of my new apartment, trying to record sound effects for the bizarre puppet sequence after the trolley and bus collide in "frida". couldn\'t figure out where the demolition and sirens were coming from...went outside to move the car and saw a cloud of smoke where the towers should have been.

properties.name: wake forest university
properties.description: Posted by Annie wake forest university, winston-salem, nci was a freshman and at sundry (the convenience store on campus) paying for my stuff and the cashier had the radio on. it sounded like something bad happened. i asked her what happened and she said something about something hitting a building. i walked back to my dorm (johnson) with increasing worry that it was something big. when i got to my room i turned on my tv and my roommate and i were glued to it for hours.
